root.para: The entity uses derivatives regularly to hedge forecasted foreign currency-denominated sales and purchases of raw materials. Derivatives are used to a lesser extent for management of U.S. interest rate risk (for example, converting fixed-rate debt to floating debt using interest rate swaps). (For purposes of this case study, only the accounting for the hedging of a forecasted foreign currency-denominated sale is illustrated.) Derivatives are not used for investment purposes.
